etymology.description: 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") + 各(各) (gè, "each") = under each roof -> guest
etymology.interpretation: 客(客) (kè, "guest") combines 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") to indicate a building or home, and 各(各) (gè, "each") as the phonetic component. Together, they symbolize a person staying under a roof other than their own, thus representing a guest.

examples.chinese: 欢迎客人进来(歡迎客人進來)。
他是国外来的客(他是國外來的客)，留宿在旅馆(留宿在旅館)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì guówài lái de kè, liú sù zài lǚguǎn.
examples.english: He is a guest from overseas, staying overnight at the hotel.

examples.chinese: 她是热情的客(她是熱情的客)，为我们带来快乐(為我們帶來快樂)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì rèqíng de kè, wèi wǒmen dài lái kuàilè.
examples.english: She is a friendly guest, bringing joy to us.
